style.name: English-Style Brown Ale
style.description: English brown ales range from copper to brown in color. They have medium body and range from dry to sweet maltiness with very little hop flavor or aroma. Roast malt tones may sometimes contribute to the flavor and aroma profile. Low to medium-low levels of fruity-ester flavors are appropriate. Diacetyl should be very low, if evident. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Bier Brewery & Taproom
breweries.description: The Bier Brewery and Taproom is excited to be one of the newest breweries in Indiana.  We are committed to the highest quality and best tasting bier in Indianapolis.  Our small size allows BIER to have the utmost control over the many different variables that go into brewing a batch of beer.

data.name: Upside Down Brown
data.description: Our brown beer is slightly sweet with rich malty and nutlike flavors.  It is lightly hopped so as not to overpower the sweetness of the grains.  Aside from the base malt, chocolate malts, roasted barley, brown malt and brown sugar are included in the brew.

data.name: Wall's End
data.description: This Northern English Brown harkens back to the beer that started it all - a brew that we simply couldn't keep in the keg. Smooth, Sessionable, Malt-focused, English-hopped. Refreshing enough for summer drinking, substantive enough to enjoy in the winter - we love this beer year-round.

Pear Fritters
Smoked Sausage
Gouda Cheese

data.description: A traditional North East Brown Ale with a twist, brewed with Bavarian smoked malt to create a subtle smoked flavour!

data.name: Whistle Blast Honey Brown
data.description: A welcoming ale, displaying warm mahogany earth tones accentuated by a thin veil of creamy foam head, our Honey Brown Ale is as inviting as the historic English pubs where the style originated. Slight roast malt character leads the nose to a warm sensuous balance of mild hop bitterness and sweet honey malt after notes. A clean, somewhat drying finish allows the sweetness of malt to shine through and remain as a memento for each sip. Quaffable in design, this ale will toast well in any social situation and keep you coming back for more. Cheers!

data.name: Who's That Brown?
data.description: Inside outside come around…Who’s that?? Browwwwwwwwn. Who’s That highlights all the classic characteristics of a Southern English Brown Ale that include toffee, nutty, bready, and roasty notes. This session Brown Ale, clocking in at 4.7% ABV, is an easy drinker for the Fall season.

breweries.name: Tow Yard Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
We are a brewery, tasting room, and restaurant located in downtown Indianapolis. Our draft list is made up of our own beers, brewed under the direction of Head Brewer Bradley Zimmerman, and a constantly rotating cast of other delicious brews. Our location is within walking distance of Banker's Life Fieldhouse, Lucas Oil Stadium, and The Indiana Convention Center. 

Our restaurant, The Larder, offers a variety of delicious eats for lunch and dinner. Chef Tommy Thompson's menu reflects his South Florida/New Orleans upbringing and his travels across the U.S. and abroad.

data.name: Winter Ale
data.description:
At Weyerbacher we’ve created a Winter Ale that is a must for any malty beer lover. Winner of a Silver Medal in the 1998 World Beer Championships, Weyerbacher Winter Ale is brewed with deep-roasted chocolate malt. The taste predominates with a warm, roasty flavor, balanced out with a slightly dry finish. It’s smooth but not cloying, with a warming belt of alcohol (5.6% ABV).

Although winter ales predate history, they are believed to have their origin in the pagan celebrations of winter solstice. Later, when monasteries produced the local brew, winter ales were made each year to commemorate the birth of Christ. Back then, winter ales were brewed full-bodied as a source of nutrition for the upcoming winter months. Today, winter ales are typified by their seasonality, their rich, malty flavors and by their deep, dark coloration.

Generally available November through February, Weyerbacher Winter Ale is the perfect libation for a winter meal, with good friends, or beside a warm fire fending off a cold winter night.
data.foodPairings: Hearty foods, roast pork, smoked sausage, and grilled salmon.

breweries.name: Weyerbacher Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Established in 1995, Weyerbacher Brewing Company, Inc. was founded in the historic city of Easton, Pennsylvania. We bring artistry, mischief and adventure to the world of brewing so every Weyerbacher beer is an incredible experience.

We, the brewers of Weyerbacher, are continually pushing the envelope of taste experiences, obliterating style guidelines and having a blast while we're at it! Cheers!

data.name: Winterbraun
data.description: A full-bodied, brown ale with a rich chocolate taste created from roasted chocolate and caramel malts. Topped with Czech Saaz Hops to give it a spicy flavor and aroma.

breweries.name: Lost Coast Brewery
breweries.description: Founded in 1989 by Barbara Groom, the Lost Coast Brewery is one of the only female-owned and operated breweries in the U.S. Lost Coast is famous for its delicious and award-winning beers: Great White, Downtown Brown, Indica IPA & Tangerine Wheat!

data.name: Wooly Booger Nut Brown Ale
data.description: Our English brown ale. A mild bodied beer that is dark in color, while at the same time full of flavor. A wonderfully drinkable beer, with slight toffee, nutty and caramel flavors.  Let the honey-like malt flavor lure you in!

data.name: Wooly Bugger Brown
data.description: An English Brown Ale brewed with American 2 Row, two caramel malts and dark chocolate malt. Hopped with Fuggles hops for a balance towards the malt side with emphasis on the light coffee caramel flavors.

data.name: Wynwood Brown
data.description: Wynwood Brown is our English Brown Ale.  Our English Brown Ale has is a nice medium bodied, reddish-brown ale with a nice malty and sweet palate.  This beer finishes off with a dry and roasted nutty characteristic.
data.foodPairings: This beer pairs excellent with heaty foods such as sausages, smoked foods and pork.  Even a nice grilled Salmon will pair well with this delicious brew.

breweries.name: Wynwood Brewing Company
breweries.description: Wynwood Brewing Company is Miami’s first craft production brewery in the heart of Wynwood Art District, featuring a tap room. We are family owned and operated with the simple objective of bringing fresh, delicious, and creative beers to thirsty South Floridians and tourists alike. We operate a 15-barrel brewhouse and distribute our blond ale, IPA, Porter, barrel aged Strong Ales and seasonal offerings.

data.name: Yarmouth Town Brown
data.description: An English Style brown ale with a rich chocolate-like profile accentuated by hints of hop flavor and aroma. A must try if you are an aficionado of brown ales.

breweries.name: Rudder's Seafood Restaurant & Brew Pub
breweries.description:
Good times, great food and hand-crafted ales are served up daily at Rudder's Seafood Restaurant  & Brew Pub.  Soak up the ambiance as you dine on fresh seafood and sip premium brewed beers, brewed on-site at South West Nova’s only microbrewery restaurant. 

Just a five-minute walk from downtown, this business is famous for its delicious seafood, excellent service and spacious wrap-around deck overlooking Yarmouth's waterfront.  The 18th- century beamed ceilings and thick plank floors of Rudder’s Seafood Restaurant are part of the draw for thousands of locals and tourists annually. 

Live entertainment can be enjoyed most nights of the week. A 12-slip floating dock marina is located on the property for the convenience of nautical guests. Rudders also offers customized private banquets and meeting facilities.

Recognized as the social hub of the waterfront, this landmark is a lively place year-round.   Expect smiles, attentive service and the occasional song from Rudder's carefully selected staff.

data.name: Yorkshire Brown
data.description: Brewed in the style of Northern England, this brown ale is dark and rich, with just a hint of chocolate malt and East Kent Golding hops in the finish.

breweries.name: The Livery
breweries.description: Over one hundred years ago, the building known as the Palace Livery provided a vital service making it a unique gathering place for residents of and travelers to Southwest Michigan. This former horse stable has been brought back to life as The Livery. Located at 190 5th street, in the Arts District of downtown Benton Harbor, Michigan, the Livery features 12 taps of "Hand-Forged Microbrew", 2 Real Ale taps, an outdoor bier garden, free WIFI, and a Café serving great food. Music and other live entertainment are regularly featured in The Upper Livery entertainment venue. You must be age 21 or older to enter The Livery. People under age 21 must be accompanied by parent or legal guardian.
